She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30 000FCFA which she will use for her family's needs and part of which she will re-invest in her tomato retail business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena. She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rowena hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gregoria has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. Gregoria requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of sand and gravel to sell to customers.

Gregoria has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty  con su anterior credikiva, compró mercancía que vendió al municipio y aumentó su rentabilidad usual.  En la actualidad se prepara para recibir su nuevo financiamiento por Kiva, pues está muy entusiasmada con las navidades y el año nuevo que se acercan, época en la cual las ventas de sus productos se incrementan y ella gana mucho más. Con su credikiva comprará queso que es su nuevo producto y también insumos para hacer tortas navideñas, con las cuales planea impactar a su clientela; así mismo comprará ropa calzado etc con el fin de responder a los pedidos de su distinguida clientela y hacer que su credikiva tenga mucho éxito una vez más.
texts.en: Betty, with her previous Kiva loan, bought merchandise that she sold in the city in order to increase her regular income.  Currently she is preparing to receive a new loan from Kiva, and she is very excited about the Christmas season and the New Year that approach.  At that time of her the sales of her products increase and she earns much more.  With her Kiva credit she will buy cheese which is her new product, as well as ingredients in order to make Christmas cakes, by which she hopes to entice her customers.  She will also buy clothing, shoes, etc. with the aim of filling the requests from her distinguished customers and making her Kiva credit a success once again.

loans.use: to buy cheese as well as ingredients in order to make Christmas cakes, by which she hopes to entice her customers.  She will also buy clothing, shoes, etc. with the aim of filling requests.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos se encuentra casado y tiene 6 hijos, y para generar el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su hogar tiene una producción agrícola de hortalizas y verduras la cual trabaja muy fuertemente todos los días. El cambio de clima ha hecho que su negocio se haya visto afectado porque ha perdido algunos cultivos, y por esto su familia ha tenido que pasar por algunas dificultades económicas. Con el ánimo de recuperar su cultivo y poderlo sacar adelante, Carlos busca un préstamo para comprar semillas e insumos que requiere para conservar su cultivo de los fuertes cambios del clima y aumentar su producción.

Carlos aspira a que con estos insumos la capacidad de producción aumente y así unas mayores ventas le permitan tener mejores ingresos para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has six children. To generate the money needed to support his household, he has an agricultural production of vegetables, where he works very hard every day. The change in climate has caused his business to be affected, because he has lost some crops, and for this reason his family has had to experience some economic difficulties. With the spirit of restoring his cultivation and being able to carry it forward, Carlos is seeking a loan to buy seeds and supplies that he needs to preserve his cultivation from the strong changes in climate and increase his production.

Carlos hopes that with these supplies his production capacity will increase and thus larger sales will allow him to have better income to offer his family a better quality of life in their household.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies that he needs to preserve his cultivation from the strong changes in the climate and increase his production.

loans.name: Wilfredo Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilfredo, Se dedica a la venta de billetes de loteria, quiere aumentar la capacidad del negocio realizando una nueva inversión, mediante un préstamo que se le pueda brindar para comprarse tres series de lotería, que semanalmente vende para el sorteo.
El considera que su experiencia con los préstamos ha sido positiva, pues ha incrementado su negocio, saliendo a las calles a ofrecer los billetes, ha tenido mejores ganancias por mantener suficiente billete para vender.
texts.en: Wilfredo sells lottery tickets and wants to expand and invest in his business by applying for a new loan to buy three series for the weekly lotteries. He says his loan history has been a success; he has increased his business as a street vendor and earned enough profits to continue selling tickets.

loans.use: to buy three lottery series.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier con su credikiva, adquirió activos con los que está muy satisfecho trabajando, el compró un anafe, vitrina y también compró insumos para elaborar sus productos alimenticios; con ello mejoró las condiciones de su productividad desde que recibió su crédito,   por eso está muy agradecido y dice que ojalá puedan seguir apoyándolo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará insumos en mayor volumen, ya que reduce su costo de producción y hará algunas mejoras locativas, que generaran un espacio mas cómodo para el desarrollo de su tarea diaria.
texts.en: Javier is pleased to be working with the assets he purchased with his previous loan. He bought a portable stove, a glass case, and supplies to prepare his food and to improve his productivity. He is very grateful and hopes the lenders will continue to support him. He is applying for a new loan to buy wholesale supplies to reduce his production costs and to make improvements to his stand that will make his work easier.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies to reduce his production costs and to make improvements to his stand.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, quiere continuar cultivando maíz y pipián, tambien la preparación del terreno, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla de maíz, herbicidas, preparar la tierra, que le servirá para asegurar una mejor cosecha.
Con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la siembra en dos manzanas de terreno, pero le afecto una escases de agua para que su cosecha no fuera buena, en su familia se ha mantenido el número de miembros, su deseo es seguir cultivando con regadillo para recuperarse de la perdida que le genero el cultivo anterior, además esta vez quiere realizar  ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz wants to continue cultivating corn and squash, as well as preparing the land.  For this reason he is asking for a new loan in order to purchase fertilizer, seed, corn, herbicides, and to prepare the land.  This will help him be assured of a better harvest.  

With the previous loan he was able to plant two acres of land, but the drought affected him and his crops were not very good.  His family maintains the same number of members.  His hope is to continue cultivating with irrigation in order to recuperate the loss from his previous crop.  This time he wants not only to recover his loss but also to make money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, corn, and herbicides in order to prepare the land.

loans.name: Synia Yanira

texts.es:
Synia, necesita dinero para invertir en la producción de granos básicos, se comprara 6 sacos de abono, herbicidas y foliares, para tener una mejor productividad de maíz y frijol, esto será una inversión buena para que su trabajo en la agricultura se realice bien.
Con el préstamo anterior considera haber tenido un efecto positivo, incremento la producción y sus ingresos, con esto ha logrado dar a su familia lo necesario para el día a día y para la escuela, gracias al crédito Kiva su situación está mejorando.
texts.en:
Synia needs money to invest in basic grain production. She will buy 6 bags of fertilizer, herbicide and foliage in order to improve productivity in the production of beans and maize. It will be a good investment to ensure her agricultural work has a successful outcome. 

She believes the previous loan produced good results, enabling her to increase production and income. As a result, she has been able to give her family everything they need for everyday life and for school. Thanks to Kiva loans her situation is improving.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, herbicide and foliage.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un préstamo para la temporada, surtiendo el negocio para atender la demanda de los jóvenes que salen de sus estudios, comprara boquitas, gaseosas, jugos, entre otros que son demandados por los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar los ingresos de sus ventas, ha adquirido un vehículo para vender de forma ambulante, con esto espera ir posicionándose económicamente con su familia.
texts.en: Juan is applying for a seasonal loan to stock his business and service the students who come after school. He will buy snacks, sodas, juices, and other items his customers want. With the previous loan, he was able to increase his sales and income and bought a vehicle so that he could offer merchandise as a street vendor. He expects that this will improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Konotieyelen Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Konotieyelen, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de calebasses, des condiments, des habits et du poisson.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Konotieyelen sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter cinq paniers de calebasses avec les revendeurs de Tona pour ensuite vendre aux clients de Fana et Bamako.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de calebasses.
texts.en:
The women of the Konotieyelen group, which is composed of married women and widows, are on average 43 years old and have two children. They all live in extended traditional families in the town of Konobougou, in the Barouéli prefecture in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighbourhood, and friendship ties. They sell calabashes, condiments, clothes, and fish.

The women in the Konotieyelen group are on their fifteenth loan.

Mariam, who is first on the right in the row of women who are sitting, plans to buy five baskets of calabashes from the salesmen in Tona to then sell to customers in Fana and Bamako.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000FCFA which she will use partly for her family's needs and partly to reinvest in her calabash business.

loans.use: To purchase calabashes.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns more income from raising pigs.

Vergenia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, noodles, eggs, and shampoo.

Vergenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, and shampoo.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying-and-selling charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years and earns more income from raising pigs.

Victoria is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo De Santa Juana Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El esfuerzo de Santa Juana” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de telas, peluquería, almacén, venta de dulces, venta de perfumes, venta de comida rápida, venta de cosméticos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Nubia, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, polera de color lila, usa cartera de color negra y en sus manos sostiene un papel, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro, lo usa suelto y largo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de arriendo de autos a pedales para niños, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja en las plazas durante las tardes, algunas veces le ayuda su esposo e hijo, en temporadas de verano su clientela aumenta, haciendo que falten autos para arrendar y se diviertan los niños, los arrienda por 10 minutos a un valor adecuado.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en distribuidoras y comercializadoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un auto a pedales.
Una de las metas de Nubia es adquirir más autos para arrendar, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida  y brindarle un buen pasar a su familia.
Nubia vive junto a su esposo,  y sus dos hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un negocio establecido, y colocar algunas sucursales para generar mayores ingresos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida por la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “El Esfuerzo de Santa Juana” and it has 17 enterprising members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are fabric sales, barber shop, warehouse, candy sales, perfume sales, fast-food sales, cosmetics sales and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Concepción.

Nubia’s a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s standing third from right to left, wearing blue jeans and a lilac shirt.  She’s got a black purse and is carrying a piece of paper in her hand.  Her hair is dark brown and she wears it long and loose.

Her line of work for the last year has been leasing out children’s pedal cars.  She comments that she works in squares during the afternoon and sometimes her husband and her son help her.  During the summer her clientele increases and she doesn’t have enough cars to rent so the children can have fun.  She rents them for ten minutes at a time at prices that are adequate for her clientele.

Merchandise she needs she buys in the city of Santiago from suppliers and low-cost vendors which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy a little pedal car for the children’s amusement.  One of Nubia’s goals is to acquire more little cars to lease in order to have a better quality of life and provide wellbeing for her family.

Nubia lives with her husband and two children who are 15 and 7 years of age and are attending school.  Her dream on a work level is to have a well-established business and to open a few branches to generate higher income.  She’s very happy and grateful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza because she’ll be able to invest in her business.  She comments that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development since she’s learned how to organize and manager her income and investments better.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the country’s largest, in southern Chile’s Biobío region.  It’s played an important historical role as a site of important battles and a relevant settlement, especially during the Arauco War, because it borders Mapuche territory.  The city currently has important economic and population development and is considered to be one of the most relevant Chilean urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial nucleuses after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to purchase a pedal car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Alto Vuelo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Alto Vuelo” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de cuadros, venta de ropa, venta de pan, venta de comida rápida, venta de carbón, venta de perfumes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Juana, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el sexto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera azul con pintitas blancas, su cabello lo usa tomado, y en sus manos sostiene una carpeta.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, desde hace 1 mes. Comenta que habilitó un espacio al lado de su casa para instalar su bazar, trabaja de lunes a domingo de las 07ºº hasta las 21ºº horas, ofrece todo lo que es confitería, mercadería y abarrotes.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para abastecer su bazar las compra en diferentes supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una vitrina para colocar su mercadería.
Una de las metas de Juana es seguir creciendo y generar más ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida y brindarles un buen pasa  a sus hijos.
Juana vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 20 y 10 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es agrandar su bazar y tener más mercadería, y a nivel familiar darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Alto Vuelo" (High Flight). It consists of 21 entrepreneurs who work in various areas, among which are: selling paintings, selling clothing, selling bread, selling fast food, selling charcoal, selling perfume, and services, among others. All the members are from the city of Concepción..

Juana, a member of this communal bank, is standing in the photo. She is in the sixth place going from right to left. She is wearing a blue T-shirt with white dots. Her hair is tied back, and in her hands she has a folder.

She has been selling general merchandise for a month. She comments that she furnished a space beside her house to set up her store. She works from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 am until 9:00 pm. She offers her customers all types of candy, merchandise, and groceries. She buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs to stock her store in various supermarkets at low cost, thus it is economically expedient. With the loan, she will buy a display case to arrange her merchandise.

One of Juana's goals is to continue growing and to generate more income to opt for a better quality of life and offer a good step forward to her children. Juana lives with her husband and their two children, ages 20 and 10, who are in school. Her dreams for her work are to enlarge her shop and have more merchandise to offer her customers, and for her family, to offer a good education to her children.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered through Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. With regard to the communal bank of which she is a part, she comments that there is very good communication in the group. In addition, the training has served her by allowing her to learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Concepción was settled at the mouth of the Bíobío river, one of the largest in the country, in the south of Chile in the Bíobío region. An important part of Chile's history, being the seat of important battles and substantial settlement, especially during the War of Arauco, because it was on the border of the Mapuche territory. Now the city has important economic and demographic development, having come to be considered one of the most important demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial urban centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy a display case to arrange her merchandise

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 25 years old. She is divorced and lives in the small village of Gardabani district with her son and parents. 

The family runs an agricultural business and has a milk cow, a calf, two pigs, and four goats. The main income for Darejan is her grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been profitable project, but also it needs more support to further develop. Several times she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop her business, but without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of the low income.

Darejan’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Darejan will cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Darejan will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to purchase stock of basic groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Telesphore

texts.en:
Telesphore is 25 years old and is married with one child. He owns a business selling various goods such as rice, sugar, lotions, soap, toothpaste, etc. He has three years of experience. His business is open from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except on Sunday each week. Telesphore currently employs two people to help him. 

Telesphore has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods for resale, such as sugar, rice, lotions, soap, and toothpaste. Through this expansion, Telesphore will be able to earn more profit, which will be used to expand his general store and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy goods such as sugar, rice, lotions, soap, and toothpaste for resale.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is 35 years old. She describes herself as happy, hardworking, and responsible with her children. Ega lives with her husband and their five children in the town of Samburu, located in the province of Coast.

Ega has a grocery store. Her children and husband help because it is the only source of income for covering the household expenses. For this reason, she constantly needs to supply her store with products. This is her first loan. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale groceries like rice, sugar, salt, flour, and tomatoes. She will also buy canned goods, soft drinks, and other items that will allow her customers to have more variety. By doing this, she will be able to obtain good earnings and improve her quality of life.

Ega dreams that lenders will continue to support her with loans, so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, salt, flour, and tomatoes, as well as canned goods, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells groceries like powered milk, toffees, canned fish, canned milk, biscuits, and other items in Elmina. She is married and has five children.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy  groceries like milk, powered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries like milk, powered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 29-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a basket weaving business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Edna works hard to earn a living so that she can help her husband in providing the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan to buy materials for basket weaving, such as buri (a native palm), wicker, straw, and others. With this, she will be able to weave more baskets to sell, augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving, such as buri, wicker, straw, and others.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
María, quiere continuar trabajando, pues considera que a través de los préstamos está generando mejores beneficios, solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de pescado y camarón, para poder seguir vendiendo.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le dio más importancia al negocio, mejorando sus ganancias y la estabilidad en su familia tambien es mejor, espera que este nuevo crédito le de continuidad a seguir mejorando.
texts.en: María wants to keep working, and her loans have helped her generate more income. She is applying for a loan to buy fish and shrimp to resell. The previous loan was very important to her business because it increased her income and provided stability. Her family is also doing better, and she expects to improve her circumstances with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Ilario

texts.es:
Ilario, ha tenido una experiencia positiva con el préstamo que obtuvo, ahora está realizando la última siembra del año. Para eso solicita un préstamo para comprarse materiales agrícolas y tambien algunas reces de repasto, su inversión será en semilla, abono, 4 terneros para la crianza y tambien concentrado.
Él manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a sembrar dos manzanas de maíz, una de maicillo, y tambien frijol, todo esto logro realizarlo del préstamo, su producción ha mejorado.
texts.en: Ilario, whose previous loan was successful, is starting the last planting of the year. He is applying for a loan to buy farm supplies and livestock: seed, fertilizer, concentrate, and four calves. He says his previous loan helped him to plant two manzanas of corn, one of sorghum, and beans and to increase production.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, concentrate, and 4 calves to raise.

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo, composé de femmes mariées, célibataires et de veuves, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’objets plastique et des tissus.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente ASSAN, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter deux sacs de riz et les condiments avec les revendeurs du marché pour la préparation des plats qui sont vendus sur place au marché de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de restauration.
texts.en: The women in the Siguidolo group that is made up of married women, spinsters, and widows, are on average 37 years old with two children. They all live in extended traditional families in Konobougou, in the Baroueli prefecture, Segou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through family, neighbourhood, and friendship ties. They do catering, they sell plastic objects, and fabrics. This is their fifteenth loan. Client Assan, who is the first person on the left in the row of women who are sitting, plans to buy two sacks of rice and condiments from the resellers at the market. This is for the preparation of dishes that she sells at the market in Konobougou, to her clientele of men and women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50 000FCFA which she will use for her family's needs and to reinvest in the catering business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda tiene 57 años, está casada con Jesús. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Eden y César. Su casa es propia y se ubica en un anexo rural ubicado en la selva central. Erlinda es una mujer ejemplar, a pesar de sus años, continúa laborando en la actividad que más le agrada. Hace 16 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de café, palta y plátanos. Erlinda dice que ambos (su esposo y ella) coordinan para poder vender sus sembríos, mientras que ella lleva a vender al mercado central de La Merced, los plátanos que cada 15 días cosecha, su esposo Jesús, comercializa, su grano de café en la cooperativa de Alto Palomar. Todo el esfuerzo que realizaron en estos años, lograron que ahora, obtengan más de 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que le producen el sustento económico para su familia. Los planes de esta pareja es incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus cultivos. Ahora tiene pensado adquirir fertilizantes para garantizar una buena cosecha para el próximo año. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el tecer crédito con MFP, donde está segura que logrará sus objetivos con su apoyo y de los integrantes de su asociación. Razón por la que se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas.
Erlinda destinará el dinero en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgánicos ( unas 12 aproximadamente), para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 57, is married to Jesús.  Together, they have 9 children, but they only live with 2 of them: Eden y César.  Erlinda lives in her own home, which is located in a rural annex of the central jungle.  She is an exemplary woman who, in spite of her age, is continuing to work in the activity that she likes the best.  She has been farming for 16 years.  Her main crops are coffee, avocados, and bananas.  

Erlinda says that she and her husband coordinate so that they can sell their crops.  While she takes their banana crops, which are harvested every 15 days, to the central market of La Merced, her husband Jesus sells their coffee beans to the Alto Palomar cooperative.  As a result of all of their efforts over the years, they now have more than 3 hectares of agricultural land where they produce the crops that support their family.  

This couple is planning to improve the quality and increase the quantity of their crops.  They now have plans to acquire fertilizers, which will guarantee them a good harvest next year.  

Erlinda belongs to the communal bank "“La unión hace la fuerza del palomar," and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is certain that she will achieve her goals with the support of her fellow group members, and it is for this reason that she is committed to paying off her loan on time.

Erlinda will use this money to buy about 12 sacks of organic fertilizers for her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Welsie

texts.en:
Welsie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Welsie requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing net, nylon, and bamboo. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Welsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment like fishing net, nylon, and bamboo.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort extracts palm oil and palm kernel oil to sell at Elmina. She has been in this business for 8 years. Comfort is married with one child.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. She will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kernel for extracting oil

loans.name: Naga Tegal Wangi Group

texts.en:
The Naga Tegal Wangi are requesting a new loan in the same amount as their previous loan. Since their last loan, nothing has changed in the membership of the group. The loan will again be used to support their pig businesses.

Ni Made will use the loan to purchase feed only. She already has a sow and 4 piglets, and she hopes the sow will give birth again. Ni Made, the group's head, could not attend the meeting because she had a ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring/dress making business in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, threads, and needles. Arlene has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en: Lasha is 31 years old, from a small village in the Kareli district. He lives with his wife, sister, and parents. The family runs an agricultural business. They have 3 pigs, 3 milk cows, and 5 calves. In addition, they have 2.2 hectares of land, where they grow beets, onions, and haricots. The harvested products are sold locally in an open market at a good price. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. Lasha has requested a loan to purchase feed for the cattle. Nowadays, the feeds are cheaper than during the winter, so Lasha plans to purchase the stock in advance. By buying the stock in advance, he will not have to sell his calves in order to purchase feed for the cattle. So, this loan is expected to increase the income of the family and improve their living conditions. Lasha awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their 8 children. He sells clothing, including shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, and other goods. He has been in this business for 4 years and has good experience in sales, which allows him to earn a better income. He works from home and also sells door-to-door. He has a regular customer base, because his clients prefer the quality, affordable prices, and good service that he offers.

Hamisi is a resourceful and honest man who is dedicated to his work. For him, the most important thing is to never give up and to meet adversities with  his head held high, because someday the door to success will be opened. He has been increasing his sales and wants to obtain a new loan that will allow him to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old and is married with two children ages 8 and 12 years. She has been in farming for 3 years producing milk, beans, wheat, sorghum, bananas, and eggs. This provides the main sources of income to meet the family's daily basic needs. She earns additional income from her employment in a tea factory.

Christine has made a loan request amounting to 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to help her buy a dairy cow and diversify her farming business. She says the acquisition of a dairy cow will improve her family's income due to a ready market for milk, and enable her pay for the education of her children.

Christine mentions poultry diseases as the major threat to farming business income. She plans to run a farm of five quality dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha de 57 años de edad, cabeza de familia, dedicada a la cría de pollos y cerdos en su residencia, desde hace varios años. Labor que le permite sostener su núcleo familiar, supliendo sus necesites básicas día a día. Pese a que empezó su negocio con muy pocos pollos su esfuerzo le ha permitido sacar adelante poco a poco su negocio, y gracias a que sus ventas vienen creciendo, necesita aumentar su capacidad de producción para suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Debido a que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente no ha podido expandirse, es por esto que  solicita un préstamo para comprar pollos de engorde y concentrado al por mayor.

Ella sueña con tener un gran negocio que le permita generar mejores ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida  para ella y su familia, ofreciendo a sus hijos un mejor educación.
texts.en: Martha is 57 and head of her household. She has been raising chickens and pigs on her property for years, a business that supports her family with its basic everyday needs. Despite starting her business with just a few chickens, she has slowly built it through hard work. Her sales continue to grow, so she needs to increase production to meet the demand. She doesn't have enough money to expand, so she is applying for a loan to buy wholesale concentrate and chickens to fatten. She dreams of having a large business that generates more income and a good life for herself and her family and provides for a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale concentrate and chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos, quiere mejorar el inventario de ropa, para poder mejorar sus ventas, se compra blusas, pantalones, trajes, ropa interior, faldas, entre otras prendas, además quiere agregar otro tipo de mercadería como cremas para el cuerpo, esta inversión espera le ayude a mantenerse en el mercado.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior mejoro su negocio, ya que invirtió en mercadería, en su familia comenta que han aumentado, su objetivo con el negocio es tener un local fijo de venta.
texts.en: Carlos wants to add to his clothing inventory so that he can increase his sales. He will buy blouses, pants, suits, underwear, skirts, and other garments. He also wants to purchase other types of merchandise such as body lotion and expects this investment will help him be successful in the market. He was able to grow his business with his previous loan by purchasing merchandise. His family has grown, and his goal is to have a permanent space for his business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, suits, underwear, and skirts.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is from the small town of Gori. She is 25 years old, is married, and lives with her family: her husband, brother-in-law, mother-in-law, sister-in-law and 3-year-old son. 

Maya has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salaries of Maya’s husband and brother-in-law, who work as soldiers. Maya distributes cosmetics among her neighbors and has a small income. According to Credo estimations, Maya’s family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Maya requested a loan from Credo to start up a trade business of clothing sales. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Maya will purchase clothes in Tbilisi for wholesale prices and resell them in her town for a profit. It will be hard work for Maya, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in clothing trading to increase her stocks and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trade.

loans.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es:
Fanny, quiere invertir en el negocio, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para adquirir maíz, quesillo, aceite, chicharrón y gas, estos son los materiales que le permiten mantener el negocio bien y atender la demanda.

Considera que el préstamo que le financio anteriormente le ha dado crecimiento, contando con todo lo necesario para trabajar, sus condiciones en la familia está bien, sus ingresos van mejorando.
texts.en:
Fanny wants to invest in her business, so she is asking for this new loan to acquire corn, farmer's cheese, oil, pork crackings, and propane, which are the materials that allow her to maintain her business well and respond to her customers' requests.

She thinks that the previous loan has helped her to grow her business, so she could count on having everything necessary for her work.  Her family's life is going well and their income continues to improve.

loans.use: to buy corn, farmer's cheese, oil, pork cracklings, and propane.

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos, reside en compañía  de su familia en  una comunidad rural del municipio de Victoria, Departamento de Yoro.
José desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para brindarle una mejor  asistencia a sus cultivos de sandia, chile y maíz.
Con el apoyo financiero él espera mejorar la calidad de su cosecha para venderla a un buen precio.
Las utilidades que obtendrá serán utilizadas para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio y ahorrar otra parte para tener un respaldo económico.
texts.en: José, 34, lives in free union with his wife; they have three children.  He lives with his family in a rural community in Victoria municipality, Yoro Department.  José has been working in agriculture since he was very young, specifically growing basic grains and vegetables.  He’s asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for laborers to better care for his watermelon, chili and corn crops.  With financial support he hopes to improve the quality of his crops to sell them at a better price.  He will use profits obtained to continue paying for his children’s schooling and to save up part of them in order to have economic back-up.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Marbin Herith

texts.es:
Marbín, solicita un préstamo nuevamente, porque tiene en sus planes invertir en insumos para realizar una nueva siembra, como abono, herbicidas, sean algunos de los materiales que se comprara para realizar su trabajo.

Comenta que su préstamo anterior, le dio la oportunidad de hacer su trabajo teniendo lo más necesario a la mano, con ello ha desempeñado una labor que ha cambiado algunos aspectos en su familia, teniendo lo mas necesario para realizar su vida con ellos.
texts.en:
Marbín is asking once again for a loan because he plans to invest in additives to make his latest planting.  Items such as fertilizer and herbicides would be some of the products he'll buy in order to do his work.

He says that his last loan gave him the opportunity to do his work with all his most necessary products at hand, with which he has carried out his work in a way that has changed some of his family's ways of life, since they also have the basic necessities for him to make a life with them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, está realizando una nueva siembra de granos básicos, por esta labor él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que estos materiales son utilizados para evitar las plagas al cultivo y para fortalecer la producción.
Juan comenta que la experiencia que ha tenido con el trabajo en prestamo, es tener lo necesario para realizar su trabajo, sin contra tiempos, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado a través del buen desarrollo en el cultivo.
texts.en: Juan is starting a new crop of basic grains which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy manure, insecticide and pesticides which are the supplies needed to prevent crop infestations and to strengthen production.  Juan comments that the experience he’s had working with credit is that he’s been able to have what he needs to do his work without any snags and his economic condition has improved thanks to the good development of his crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Cascada De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Cascada de Esperanza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, venta de carteras, venta de comida rápida, realización de eventos, venta de pan, venta de accesorios de casa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Maria, integrante del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón y chaqueta de color café, en sus piernas tiene su cartera de color negro, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, ofreciendo todo tipo de comidas, además de la preparación de empanadas, trabaja de lunes a lunes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, también realiza la venta de perfumes y mercadería en general en su negocio que está habilitado en una parte de su casa.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para la venta de comida los compra en varias partes como supermercados, carnicerías, molinos (harina a muy buen precio) bodegas, y la ropa, perfumes y accesorios en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará carne, cebollas,aceite y algunos adornos navideños, juguetes, ropa interior.
Una de las metas de Maria es seguir con el negocio, crecer aun más, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo. Sus sueños a nivel personal y familiar tener unas lindas y largas vacaciones junto a su esposo para relajarse y disfrutar de un nuevo paisaje.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called ‘Cascada de Esperanza’ [Waterfall of Hope].  It is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who are in different lines of work.  Among those you will find selling perfume, selling clothes, selling wallets, selling fast food, organizing events, selling bread, selling home accessories, and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Valparaíso.

Maria is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she is seated in the first row, and she is the first person on the right.  She is wearing pants and a brown jacket, and her black purse is on her lap.  Her hair is light brown, and she wears it short.

She has been selling food for three years.  She says that she works at her house, and she sells all types of food.  In addition to making empanadas, she works Mondays through Mondays.  Her schedule is made according to her availability.  She also sells perfume and general merchandise in her business, which is set up in part of her house.

She buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs for her food sales at various places like supermarkets, butcher’s shops, mills (flour at a very good price), and grocery stores.  She buys the clothes, perfume, and accessories for a low cost in the city of Santiago, which is financially desirable.  

She will use the loan to buy meat, onions, cooking oil, and some Christmas decorations, toys, and underwear.  One of Maria’s goals is to continue with the business and to grow even more.  This way she can opt for a better quality of life.

Maria lives with her husband.  Her dream on a personal and familial level is to have a beautiful and large vacation with her husband in order to relax and enjoy new scenery.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  Regarding the communal bank she belongs to, she says that there is very good communication.  The trainings have taught her new strategies for selling and book-keeping.

Valparaiso is located 120 kilometers Northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also host of the country's legislature. It is the nation's first port and offers a variety of landmarks both beautiful and picturesque. For example, the house of Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize, is located here.

loans.use: to buy meat, onions, cooking oil, and some Christmas decorations, toys, and underwear.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 66 years old and married; she has five children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. Conchita has been in this business for 32 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Conchita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María, quiere un nuevo préstamo para poder mejorar el negocio, comprándose los productos necesarios para que su negocio este bien, por ejemplo aceite, elotes, leña y gas, estos son algunos de los cuales son necesarios para preparar la venta de tamales.
Comenta que el préstamo que se le financio anteriormente, le permitió tener lo más necesario para elaborar los tamales, sus condiciones, su nivel de vida han sido mejor, han tenido más oportunidad de obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan to improve her business, buying the products that she needs for her business to be in good shape.  For example, she will buy oil, sweet corn, wood, and propane, which are some of the items necessary to make her tamales (a traditional dish made of cornmeal, sauce, and meat wrapped in palm leaves) for sale.

She notes that the loan she received the last time allowed her to have the most needed items to make her tamales, and her living conditions and level of comfort have improved, and she has a better opportunity to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn on the cob, wood, and propane.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
La señora Teodolinda tiene 53, es soltera, tiene tres hijos, reside en compañía de 3 nietos una comunidad del municipio de Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Teodolinda desde hace 7 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado de manera estacionaria. Además para generar otros ingresos mantiene una cría de cerdos.
Ella se vio motivada a  establecer su negocio con el fin de apoyar a sus nietos con la crianza y educación.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de ropa y calzado para damas, caballeros y niños(as).
Considera que el préstamo le ayudara a aumentar su inventario y disponer de variedad de mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en la temporada navideña.
texts.en: Teodolina, 53, is single and has three children.  She lives with three grandchildren in a community in Morazán, Yoro Department.  For the last seven years she’s been selling clothes and shoes in a stationary way.  In order to generate extra income she also raises pigs.  She was motivated to start her business in order to support her grandchildren helping to raise and school them.  She’s asking for a 12,000 Lempira loan to buy clothes and shoes for women, men and children.  She feels that the loan will help her increase her inventory and have a good selection of merchandise to satisfy customer demand for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nurul Hikmah 3 Group

texts.en:
Siti, 43 years old, has been blessed with four children: Siska already works, Fauziah and Inas are in Senior and Junior High School, and Inus is still a toddler. Mohammad, her husband, works as a driver of public transportation. He is paid only 100,000 IDR every day. Therefore Siti sells cooked food  for breakfast every day, from  5 am – 7 am in front of her house, to help her husband and fulfill her children's educational needs. Siti has loyal customers, and every day she earns a profit of 75,000 IDR. 

Siti will use her part of this loan to expand her business, by beginning to sell instant cold drinks and mobile phone minutes cards. Too little capital and the competition are her obstacles in running this business.

loans.use: to buy instant drink powder and mobile phone minutes cards.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: Doña Benigna tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Manuel Cortes junto a su hija mayor. Ella tiene muchos años de experiencia en confección de ropa de vestir. Tiene su propio taller establecido en su casa. Confecciona vestidos, faldas, blusas, trajes, pantalones, y otros trabajos de costura. Ya tiene su buena clientela en la colonia donde vive. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar una máquina de coser y telas para la confección de ropa. Con esta inversión ella quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientes en la época navideña. Su plan es lograr que su negocio prospere y crezca día a día para mejorar la economía del hogar y ser un soporte para su familia. Agradece el apoyo brindado con este financiamiento.
texts.en: Benigna, 56, is a single mother; she has four children and lives in San Manuel Cortes with her oldest daughter.  She has many years’ experience working as a dressmaker.  She has her own workshop set up at home.  She makes dresses, skirts, blouses, suits, pants and other items.  She has a well-established local clientele in her neighborhood.  She’s decided to request a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make clothes.  She wants to use this investment to be ready for customers during the Christmas season.  Her plan is to succeed in making progress with her business so that it will grow day to day to improve her home’s economy and be a source of family support.  She is grateful for the support provided by this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque quiere surtir el negocio de frutas y verduras frescas, ya que se avecina una temporada de mas demanda, para esto deberá estar preparada económicamente, con papas, repollo, tomates, plátanos, zanahorias, cebollas, por ejemplo.
Su efecto reflejado en el negocio ha sido la mejoría en la inversión para tener surtido el negocio, su familia se ha mantenido económicamente estable, ella ha dejado de vender atol por unos meses, solo queda con las verduras y frutas que son más rentables.
texts.en:
Carolina is asking for a new loan because she wants to stock her market stall with fresh fruits and vegetables.  It is getting to be the time of year when there is greater demand, and for this reason, she should be economically prepared with a stock of potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, plantains, carrots, and onions, as some examples.

The effect that has been reflected in her business has been an improvement via her investment, so that she now has a fully stocked shop.  Her family has been able to maintain its financial stability.  She has been able to stop selling atol (a traditional corn gruel) over the past few months, and she now only sells the most profitable fruits and vegetables in her stall.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, plantains, carrots, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a fish vendor from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 20 years. This is the source of her income. 

Primitiva is asking for a loan to buy additional fish to sell to the people in her community.

Primitiva hopes to imrpove her business in the future, and she saves money for reinvestment in the same venture and for her future use.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: José Nilson

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos, reside en compañía  de su familia en  una comunidad rural del municipio de Victoria, Departamento de Yoro.
José  tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, particularmente a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y fríjoles).
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar  sus cultivos de maíz y fríjoles.
Con el apoyo financiero él espera mejorar su producción.
Su meta es que sus hijos estudien y lograr un buen record crediticio con ODEF.
texts.en: José, 41, lives in free union with his wife; he has three children.  He lives with his family in a rural community in Victoria, Yoro Department.  He’s been working in agriculture for more than 20 years, especially growing basic grains (corn and beans).  He’s currently asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan he plans to use to buy fertilizer to fertilize his corn and bean crops.  He hopes to improve production with the loan.  His goal is that his children study and for him to establish a good credit history with ODEF.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Yilmer Andres

texts.es:
Yilmer es un joven emprendedor de tan solo 18 años de edad y debido a que lleva trabajando durante muchos años al lado de su padre en la actividad de la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, espera poder iniciar su propio negocio y así generarse sus propios ingresos, de modo que un futuro pueda brindarles a sus padres y hermanos una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Gracias al tiempo que ha trabajado con su padre ha podido adquirir la experiencia, y aprovechando esto aspira a que en su negocio pueda crecer rápidamente. La mayor dificultad que tiene es el poco capital con el que cuenta para iniciar el negocio, es por esto que Yilmer busca un préstamo para comprar el surtido inicial de frutas y verduras y así iniciar con su propio negocio de compra y venta de frutas y verduras.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran negocio donde pueda tener buenas ventas y así los ingresos que reciba le permitan brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Yilmer is a young enterpriser, merely 18 years old, and because he has spent many years working along side of his father in the business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables he hopes to be able to begin his own business and thus generate his own income in a way that in the future he can offer his parents and siblings a better quality of life at home.  Thanks to the time that he has worked with his father, he has been able to aqcuire experience and has taken advantage of this, hoping that his business will grow quickly.  The greatest difficulty that he has is the small amount of money that he has to begin the business; this is why Yilmer asks for a loan to buy the initial assortment of fruit and vegetables and thus start his own business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

His dream is to come to have a great business where he can have good sales so that the income he receives allows him to offer his family a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy an initial assortment of fruits and vegetables and thus start his own business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mirian Selina

texts.es:
La Señora  Mirian tiene 55 años de edad,  está casada, tiene 5 hijos, reside en compañía  de su familia en  una comunidad rural del Municipio de San Francisco, Departamento de Atlántida.
Mirian tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos alimenticios a través de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación.
Decidió establecer su negocio con la motivación de contribuir con los gastos familiares.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos como: maíz, fríjoles, arroz, azúcar, carnes, lácteos, productos de limpieza, medicamentos de uso común, golosinas y refrescos.
Con el apoyo financiero ella espera aumentar la variedad de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mirian, 55, is married and has five children.  She lives with her family in a rural community in the municipality of San Francisco, Atlántida Department.  Mirian has been selling food items in her grocery store located at home for the last four years.  She decided to start the business motivated by the wish to contribute towards family expenses.  She’s currently asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy food items like corn, beans, rice, sugar, meats, dairy products, cleaning supplies, common use medicines, snacks and soft-drinks.  She hopes with help from the loan to increase the variety of products she has to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 8 hijos y vive en el sector de Cofradia, Cortes. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, pero hace más de un años decidió mejor establecer una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, harina, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, refrescos, y otros productos de abarrotería. Doña maría ha sido cliente de ODEF por diez ciclos de préstamos, el que solicita actualmente es de 6,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir el negocio de mas productos como lácteos, granos básicos, manteca, café, pan, azúcar, jabón y refrescos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener surtido y atender mejor a su clientela. su meta es seguir trabajando para tener un nivel económico y apoyar a sus hijos con la educación y en un futuro ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
María, 45, is married and has 8 children; she lives in the Cofradía sector, Cortes.  She used to sell tortillas but over a year ago decided to open a grocery store where she sells basic staples like rice, beans, lard, eggs, flour, dairy products, canned goods, meats, soft-drinks and other grocery items.  

María has been an ODEF client for ten loan cycles and the one she’s asking for now is for 6,000 Lempiras that she will use to stock the store with more products like dairy products, basic grains, lard, coffee, bread, sugar, soap and soft-drinks.  This investment will help her keep the store well-stocked in order to provide better customer service.  Her goal is to continue working to have a better standard of living and to help with her children’s schooling and in the future expand the business more.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Blue Mary

texts.en:
Blue Mary is 46 years old and single.

Blue Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, eggs, spices, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.  

Blue Mary has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and farming sugarcane.

Blue Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a petty trader who sells plastic bowls, baskets, buckets and containers in Elmina. She has done this for some years now. She is married with 3 children, and she uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls, baskets and containers to sell. With her profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, baskets and containers to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has been in the farming business for thirty years in her rural home in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya where she lives with her family of six children aged between fourteen and twenty-five years. She sells her products which mainly consist of milk and vegetables to the local market.

Agnes has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy a dairy cow. She says this will enable her to generate biogas fuel for use within the family as well as add manure to her farm. She believes the income will improve her family's living standards in terms of food provision and general health.

Her focus is to repay the loan and acquire a bigger amount from Juhudi Kilimo in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase machines and equipment for his work.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que esta bien en sus ventas y por eso necesita invertir para aumentar su potencia en la tienda, se comprara embutidos, cereales, leche, huevos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, entre otros que sean de la preferencia de los clientes.
El efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior al negocio, fue aumentar su disponibilidad en el inventario, para movilizar más las ventas, considera que su forma ha cambiado, gracias a la inversión que realizo, el techo de su vivienda le realizo reparaciones, para evitar goteras en tiempo de lluvia.
texts.en:
José has decided to ask for a new loan, since he thinks that he is doing quite well in his business, and for this reason, he wants to invest and increase the attractiveness of his grocery store.  He will buy snacks, grains, milk, eggs, rice, sugar, beans, and other goods that his customers prefer.

The effect that his previous loan had upon his business was to expand the readiness of his store's inventory to make his business have more turnover.  He believes that his method of doing business has changed thanks to the investment he was able to make, and he was able to make repairs to the roof of his house to avoid having leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy snacks, grains, milk, eggs, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, bathing suits, underwear, and pants.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 30, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jerome, who is employed, the father of their children. She and her husband share responsibility for attending to their young children and at the same time earning an income for their daily needs. 

Liezel is a balut vendor. In the Philippines balut is well-known egg that is sold in the sidewalk. It is a duck egg that has not been hatched. Instead, it is cooked as a boiled egg with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is a highly nutritious food that Filipinos love, especially when they feel tired, as it revitalizes their energy and strength. Se and her husband boil and sell about 450-600 balut eggs every night. They do the selling themselves to avoid the commissions of vendors who would sell it. They earn 300 PHP in sales per day.  

Liezel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to  buy balut and quail eggs. She also has a variety store, and she will use part of the loan to buy groceries and toiletries. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liezel dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life. She never fails to attend weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to go on with her life, no matter what are the obstacles, because she has a big God Who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more balut eggs, quail eggs, and items for her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bags of rice, maize, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, 26, is the mother of two young children. She lives with her husband and children in the rural area of Samburu where charcoal selling is the most popular activity.
Six months ago she decided to start selling charcoal from her home. She sells to the neighborhood.

Aiming at widening her stock of merchandise, Mwanasiti has requested a 20,000 KES loan. She believes that with financial help she’ll attain business growth that will lead to an improvement in the quality of her family life

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single mother with one child.  She sells rice, canned fish, canned tomatoes and other things in Elmina, Ghana.  She has done this for some years now.  She uses her income for the upkeep of her child. Comfort will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, boxes of canned fish, tomatoes and other things for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, boxes of canned fish, tomatoes and other things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old now, married to Stanley, and supports a family of five members. She operates a green grocery and she has been in the business for the last two years. Her monthly income is KES. 10,000.
 
She is currently servicing her second loan from KADET LTD of KES.30,000 that will facilitate purchasing more fruits and vegetable for the now expanded store.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them to sell. She also cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce. Aba has been in this business for some years now. She is married with 3 dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe their children. Aba  will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry, rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and others to prepare her food for sale. Aba will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry, rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and others to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, compost, fertilizers and pesticides, among other things.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en: Aleksi, 40, is from the small village of Kareli district. He lives with his wife and 3 infant children. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2.4 hectares of land, on which they grow wheat, nut trees, cherry trees and plum trees. The harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Besides, Aleksi is an artisan and works locally and gets a monthly income. Aleksi requested a loan to help him cultivate his land and buy wheat seeds. After the land is cultivated properly, he will be able to sow wheat and increase the family's income. With this increased income, the living conditions of his family will be improved. Aleksi awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells grocery like powdered milk, toffees, powdered pepper, biscuits, and others at Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Philomena has been in this business for some years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to buy groceries like milk, powdered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish and others to satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries like milk, powdered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five adult children from Antequera, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store. She sells various goods to the people in her neighborhood.

Anecita wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she joined CEVI to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization.

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries for her store, such canned goods, dry goods, snack food, soda, detergent and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to attract more customers and buyers to her store and thus augment her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store, such canned goods, dry goods, snack food, soda, detergent and toiletries.

loans.name: Lourdes Esperanza

texts.es:
Lourdes, está solicitando un  préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio, por ejemplo leña, diez medidas de maíz, papel, bolsas, entre otras cosas que sean necesarias para que el negocio funcione mejor.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, mejoro su inversión en maíz y leña, a un precio cómodo, con esto logro tener la suficiente cantidad para la venta, en este periodo ha agregado la venta de refrescos, aprovechando los clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy materials for her business, such as firewood, corn, paper, and bags, among other necessities, so that her business can run better.
